step1.sentence: After months of practice, she finally leveled up her public speaking skills and landed the promotion.

step2.story: Jake had been stuck at the same junior developer position for two years. He decided it was time to level up by enrolling in an advanced algorithms course. Within six months, he earned a senior role and a significant raise.

step3.story: Maria stared at the rejection letter from her dream company and felt a familiar sting. She had applied three times now, and each time the feedback was the same — strong potential, but not quite ready. Instead of giving up, she treated the feedback as a roadmap to level up. She signed up for a data science bootcamp, started contributing to open-source projects, and began writing articles about her learning journey. A year later, she walked into her fourth interview with a portfolio that spoke for itself. This time, the answer was yes.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 레벨(단계)을 올린다는 뜻으로, 원래 게임에서 캐릭터의 등급이 상승하는 것을 의미한다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 기술, 능력, 지위 등을 향상시키거나 더 높은 수준으로 발전하는 것을 뜻하며, 자기계발이나 커리어 성장 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 비디오게임에서 경험치를 쌓아 캐릭터 레벨이 오르는 개념에서 유래했으며, 2000년대 이후 일상 언어로 확산되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 능동적인 뉘앙스를 지니며, 단순한 향상이 아니라 의도적인 노력으로 질적 도약을 이루는 느낌을 준다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He took an online course to level up his coding skills.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 코딩 실력을 레벨업하기 위해 온라인 강의를 수강했다.
